str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To irritate, provoke, be angry. From orge; to provoke or enrage, i.e. become exasperated.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
An army, detachment of troops. From strateuomai; an armament, i.e. a body of troops.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To burn, set on fire, suffer inflammation. From en and pretho; to enkindle, i.e. Set on fire.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
